title: From Online Conventions To Teen Poll Workers, The Virus Is Transforming Election 2020
description:
States are scrambling to replace older poll workers with younger ones. The two major political parties will hold their conventions mostly online. And in one big battleground state, the pandemic is shifting the political geography.

NPR's latest battleground state map is here.

Find and support your local public radio station.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: From Online Conventions To Teen Poll Workers, The Virus Is Transforming Election 2020
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Older poll workers are staying home, and states are scrambling to replace them with younger ones. Plus NPR's latest battleground state map.
